title: What is the significance of the name “Hristi” in the Orthodox Christian Church?
self_text: The term “Hristi” (Christ) is a Greek word for “redeemer”, but it’s not the only meaning associated with it. In the Old Testament, there was a ritual sacrifice of a lamb for atonement for sins.  The priest would place his hands on the lamb's head and pronounce a specific blessing over it. Then he would take a handful of its blood and sprinkle it before the altar as an offering to God for the forgiveness of sin. This was done every year.   In the New Testament, when Jesus came into the world, he became the ultimate lamb and atoned for the sins of all people, both Jews and Gentiles. He took upon himself the penalty for our sins and died on the cross so we could be redeemed from eternal punishment. He then rose again from the dead and ascended to heaven, where he now reigns with his Father.   His sacrifice was more than just an animal being sacrificed; it was an act of love, and redemption, which allowed us to enter into fellowship with God.    When the Orthodox Church says “Hristi” (Christ), it's referring to His ultimate sacrifice for the salvation of humanity. So, the meaning of “Hristi” goes beyond the literal translation of the word.   It also refers to the idea of redemption through Christ's death, burial, and resurrection.   It represents the ultimate sacrifice for the forgiveness of sins.  We can find references to the word “Hristi” in the Bible such as Romans 5:8: “But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, God reconciled us to himself through the Lord Jesus Christ.”

title: What if Islam was taught in schools?
self_text: I don't know what religion you people practice or what your beliefs are but it seems like everyone has an opinion on it and nobody wants to listen to anyone else. I used to be a devout Christian and wanted to teach the children about Jesus, but I was told I couldn't because of the separation of church and state. Now, there's no such thing as separation of church and state anymore.   I believe the Quran would be taught to the children as well.  If they were taught it, they would have learned more than just what they had been taught about Christianity.   I think we should be teaching the children about every religion so they can understand why different people have different beliefs.   It will help them learn to get along with each other.  It also helps them to appreciate different cultures.

title: No way it's just the beginning
self_text: I know that what's going on with Ukraine is a tragedy and I feel so bad for all the people who are affected but I can't help but be excited about the future! The fact that Russia invaded a sovereign country like Ukraine will not just have devastating consequences for the Ukrainian people but also for the world.  I believe that the west will finally realize how weak they were in terms of security and defense after this invasion. We need to start preparing for WW3 if Putin doesn't change his ways.   The US government should finally invest into our military instead of giving away money to foreign countries or building useless infrastructure projects. We need to build up our navy and air force because China will try to take over Taiwan soon and we're too busy being distracted by social media. I think the time has come for America to be an imperialist superpower again.

title: The Great Waffle Debate
self_text: Let's get down to it folks. I am an orthodox Christian, and my best friend is a devout Muslim. We both enjoy waffles. However, we have differing opinions on how they should be eaten.   I believe in eating them upside down, so the syrup doesn't make a soggy mess. You're supposed to let the syrup sit on top and soak into the waffle.  He says that's blasphemous and that the syrup is meant to flow over the entire thing. This is a serious issue for me.   So, what do you guys think? Is there any way we can reconcile our views?

title: Game Feel
self_text: I am a game developer trying to get my indie title off the ground and am working on establishing good feel in the movement system. I want to make sure players feel like they are actually moving through the world at their own pace with no awkward or unnatural pauses. This isn't just about making it smooth, but also about giving the player a sense of control over their character and how they interact with the environment.  I have been looking into various techniques to accomplish this and want to test out a few different approaches for my specific game genre (action-adventure) which involves verticality as well as horizontal movement.  It’s important to note that this game has 2 main movement systems, one for horizontal movement and another for vertical movement. The horizontal movement feels good so far but it is the vertical movement I’m most concerned with.

self_text: I'm not sure if it was just a dream or what but at the end of season 5, when Uthred was on his deathbed, he had a vision of Alfred being killed by a Viking and then he died with a smile. Does this mean that Alfred will die in the next season?

title: What does the last verse of "The Fire Within" mean?
self_text: In my opinion it means the last verse of “The Fire Within” by The Script speaks about finding peace in your own suffering and being able to look at a situation with perspective, instead of letting it consume you.  It’s saying that you can turn something bad into something good, like using a broken piece of glass to make a beautiful sculpture.   Also, I think it has a bit of a religious connotation too, speaking about forgiveness. You need to forgive yourself for making mistakes and move on.  It is not easy but if you focus on the beauty of life and what you have instead of dwelling on what you lost, you will be able to find peace.

title: [spoiler] The ending of the last episode of the reunion of Game Shakers[/spoiler]
self_text: I think they did a good job with the ending, but I'm not sure if it was a good way to end the series.  The ending itself wasn't bad at all and it felt like it was what they were going for, but it just feels like it should have happened earlier.   They could have had more time to develop the characters and the story lines.   It would have been better if the characters got together earlier in the show so we didn't have to wait as long for them to get together.   Also, I am just saying this because I've been watching this series since 2016 and I know how it ends. I don't want anyone to spoil anything else to me!

title: PC Building for the first time?
self_text: Hi! I'm looking at getting a new PC built and I want it to be as good as possible on my budget. My budget is $1000 or less. I am an avid gamer and I mostly play RPGs like Skyrim and Witcher 3 but I also dabble in FPS games such as Overwatch.  I want to build a PC that can handle both genres well. What do you guys think about this parts list:   CPU : AMD Ryzen 5600X (About $200)   Motherboard: ASUS Prime B450M-A II   RAM : Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4 3200MHz ($70)   GPU : RTX 3060 12gb ($300)   SSD : Samsung 970 EVO Plus 1TB NVMe M.2 SSD ($90)   PSU : Corsair RM650x ($130)   Case : Corsair 4500D Airflow ($90)   Total: ~$890   Is there any upgrades I should consider or anything that would make my experience better?

It’s wild how quickly technology changes.

title: The Last Of Us Part II - "Fireflies"
self_text: I think it's fair to say most people hated the ending of TLOU2 but I actually loved it.  I felt like it was a very realistic conclusion to Ellie's story and her struggle with guilt and trauma.   The fact that she killed Joel in the end and then immediately went back to hunting down his murderers just made me feel more empathy for her. I believe she was stuck in a vicious cycle of revenge and I thought it would be interesting if she ultimately decided to let go of her anger and find peace instead.

title: Unbelievable thing with my old PC
self_text: I was cleaning out my garage and found a bunch of old electronics. There were two old monitors, an old keyboard, an old mouse, and my old desktop. The computer was not running but I thought it would be cool if I could get it up and running again just for fun.  I plugged in the monitor, the keyboard, and the mouse and then I went to turn on the power supply. I pressed the button and it lit up! But when I tried to boot the computer, it didn't do anything. So I turned the computer off and tried again, but nothing happened. Then I looked at the motherboard and noticed that there wasn't any CMOS battery. So I bought one and installed it. I tried turning the computer back on and it booted into Windows XP. I started installing drivers and then I realized something...the computer still had the old hard drive from before and the new SSD I put in was being ignored.  So I used the command prompt to see which drive was being recognized and found that the old hard drive was being seen as C: while the SSD was being seen as D:. So I renamed the drives and made the SSD as C: so the OS would recognize it. After doing that, the computer booted into Windows 10.  I am just amazed that the computer ran after all these years.   This really blew my mind!
